_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Facility Policy: The owners, management and employees of Fairfax Fertilizer Service Company are

committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release

should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Atchison County LEPC, and/or

others authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the public and the environment.



2. Facility Information. The primary activity at the facility is the distribution of products to farmers. The fertilizer product, anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a nurient for crop production, Anhydrous ammonia is stored in tanks designed for this purpose.



3. Accidental Release Prevention Program. This facility follows the provisions of the U. S. Occupational

Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia"

and our State regulations covering anhydrous ammonia.



4. Five-Year Accident History. There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia during the

past five-years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, has there been any accidental releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage, or environmental damage.



5. Emergency Response Program. The facility has an Emergency Action Plan. We do not plan to have our

employees respond to a major release. If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at our facility,

the response action is to evacuate the area of the release and call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers listed in our Emergency Action Plan.



6. Planned Changes To Inprove Safety. Safety improvement is an ongoing process at this facility. Periodic

evaluations are performed to access the conditions of the facility. We are in the process of reviewing our

prevention program and making necessary changes.
